item.description:
NEW STUFF:
It looks like the rain and cold will make tomorrow a pretty junky day out, so let's try for May Day instead! Please be sure to RSVP for the new date!

--Dana

OLD STUFF:
We meet in dark places. We're inside in snowy weather, but also in sunshiney weather. We're Mole People, let's face it. So I thought it'd be fun if we could go off on a tangent and have a NoMov -- a gathering where we don't see a movie and actually get some exercise and fresh air. (Insert gasp here!)

Some of you may know that in December, my husband, Paul, and I adopted a greyhound, whom we've named Jacoby (after Ellsbury of the Red Sox). Fewer of you know that I've started a greyhound meetup to meet a few of my neighbors who also have the hounds. I thought it'd be fun to combine the two groups and have a walk.

You can bring your dog, you can bring your neighbor's dog, you can "borrow" a dog from a random backyard, or you can come without a pup at all. We'll welcome everyone, as long as the dogs remain on leashes the entire walk and are relatively well-behaved on a leash. This park is lousy with pups on Saturdays, and almost all the dogs on the trail around the park are leashed (besides, it's the law and I don't want to spend the afternoon looking for a dog that ran away).

Please, for the sake of everyone in the group, human and canine, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE make sure your dog is up-to-date on rabies shots and other vaccines.

Steady rain will postpone this event, so stay tuned to your email the morning of if it looks like it could be a possibility. RAIN DATE: Saturday, May 1.

Tercentennial Park in Framingham has a very nice, wide, paved route around the perimeter. I think the circuit is a mile around. We'll probably do a few loops around the park, but you can join us for as many loops as you want to.

We'll meet at 2:00 by the front of the trail, right by the parking lot and some of the memorial plaques. There is a parking lot off Dudley Road that runs parallel to the road. If you can't find parking there for some reason, there is a bigger lot just to the east on the corner of Cushing Way and Dudley Rd. If you get lost, call me.

Please RSVP so I know who to expect and who to wait for. If you don't know me, you'll probably notice Jacoby first -- he looks like a cross between a deer and a horse (he's a big boy!) and he's insanely friendly.

Hope to see you on 4/17!

--Dana
508/308-4897
item.how_to_find_us: Look for Jacoby, the big brindle greyhound who prances like a horse, with me! (I look like my picture.)
item.name: NoMov--Hoofing it With the Hounds
